docs.snippet: A U.S. citizen serving as a foreign diplomat from the Dominican Republic is not immune from criminal prosecution in a United Nations bribery scandal, a judge ruled Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. citizen serving as a foreign diplomat from the Dominican Republic is not immune from criminal prosecution in a United Nations bribery scandal, a judge ruled Thursday.

headline.main: Judge: US Citizen Serving as Foreign Diplomat Can Face Trial
headline.print_headline: Judge: US Citizen Serving as Foreign Diplomat Can Face Trial

docs.snippet: An Israeli court on Thursday sentenced two Israeli minors for the murder of a 16-year-old Palestinian in 2014, sending one to life in prison for a crime that provoked deep soul-searching in Israel and was one of a series of events that led to the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Israeli court on Thursday sentenced two Israeli minors for the murder of a 16-year-old Palestinian in 2014, sending one to life in prison for a crime that provoked deep soul-searching in Israel and was one of a series of events that led to the Gaza war later that year.

headline.main: Israeli Court Sentences 2 Over Palestinian Teenager's Murder
headline.print_headline: Israeli Court Sentences 2 Over Palestinian Teenager's Murder

headline.main: Manziel Not Charged Despite Claims He Hit Ex-Girlfriend
headline.print_headline: Manziel Not Charged Despite Claims He Hit Ex-Girlfriend

docs.snippet: Abortion rights activists are seizing on the crisis to push back against conservative lawmakers who want to toughen already stringent limits....
docs.lead_paragraph: Abortion rights activists are seizing on the crisis to push back against conservative lawmakers who want to toughen already stringent limits.
docs.abstract: Growing number of reports of Brazilian babies being born with condition known as microcephaly has kindled debate in country over its extremely prohibitive abortion laws; legal scholars are mounting case to make it legal for women to seek abortions in cases of microcephaly, and abortion rights activists are using crisis to criticize conservative lawmakers who have sought to make country's already restrictive laws even more stringent.

headline.main: Surge of Zika Virus Has Brazilians Re-examining Strict Abortion Laws
headline.print_headline: Zika Reignites Battle in Brazil Over Abortion

byline.contributor: Catherine Saint Louis contributed reporting from New York, Anna Jean Kaiser from Rio de Janeiro, and Paula Moura from São Paulo, Brazil.

docs.snippet: The U.S. Justice Department is considering legal changes to combat what it sees as a rising threat from domestic anti-government extremists, senior officials told Reuters, even as it steps up efforts to stop Islamic State-inspired attacks at home....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Justice Department is considering legal changes to combat what it sees as a rising threat from domestic anti-government extremists, senior officials told Reuters, even as it steps up efforts to stop Islamic State-inspired attacks at home.

headline.main: U.S. Eyes Ways to Toughen Fight Against Domestic Extremists
headline.print_headline: U.S. Eyes Ways to Toughen Fight Against Domestic Extremists
